Fun Stuffs

Whenever I'm not on my computer, I'm either working out or playing ping pong.

Career Summary

A resourceful Data Engineer and Embedded Systems Researcher. Dynamic and proficient, with hands-on experience in IoT, Big Data and Mobile App Development. Effective in leadership, collaborating and exceptional in taking up challenges. Working toward becoming a research leader in the emerging field of IoT and Data Science.

Research Interests

I am interested in building software and hardware tools and technologies that enable batteryless sensors to power the Internet of Things. I am also enthused about the application of Machine Learning Algorithms on realtime and historical IoT datasets.

News

(03/2018)  I will be attending the Computing Research Association Grad Cohort Workshop in San Diego, California.

(08/2017)  I started my graduate program at Clemson University and joined the PERSIST Research Lab.

Selected Projects

UV Risk Detection and Prevention

This system is a set of wearable devices that inform the user about UV exposure rate. One device senses UV radiation and the other displays the UV radiation levels. The display device shows the current and average UV index.

  Code

Clemson Gameday Queue Warning

In a bid to assuage the impact of high level of traffic experienced on Clemson Gamedays, we modeled a custom queue warning system for use on game days using software Verification and Validation Tools and Techniques.

  Code
